page.title: 18Media-Silloth Community News
page.content: At the June Town Council Meeting, Mrs. J.Goldsborough was elected Mayor. Mrs. Ellwood,the Green Amenities Supervisor has retired and Mrs. Statton has taken over. There are lots of local trips organised for June and July, including one to York by Radio Cumbria. Some people would like to see a pier built to replace the one washed away after the war. A new pop group has been set up by a young man named Martin Senior. Mrs J. Norton has formed a dressmaking group.Silloth Tennis Club now has more than 60 members.The Soccer club awards were presented to junior players of the year _ under-14, Anthony Clark:and under-16, Ian Carruthers. Last month a sponsored charity match raised Â£918. Live music is making quite a come-back at local clubs and pubs. The railway marshalling yard has now been levelled and seeded for sports pitches.{Cont'd
